description: Aromatic chicken cooked in a rich, spiced sauce with sultanas, mint and green chilli. Try this chicken korma recipe for a flavourful family dinner.
name: Bangladeshi Chicken Korma Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken, yoghurt, sugar, garlic and ginger in a large bowl. Season with salt, then mix well to combine. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.

Meanwhile, heat a large, deep frying pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds, then cook for 1 minute, stirring, or until fragrant. Transfer to a spice grinder or mortar and pestle, then grind to a fine powder.
Heat half of the ghee and 1 cinnamon stick in same pan over medium heat. Add chicken, in 2 batches, and cook for 4 minutes, turning, or until browned. Transfer chicken to a plate.

Heat remaining ghee in same pan over medium heat. Add onion, cardamom, peppercorns and remaining cinnamon stick, then cook for 6 minutes, stirring, or until onion is golden. Add nutmeg, coriander and cumin, then stir for 1 minute or until fragrant.

Return chicken to pan with milk, then bring to the boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, for 15 minutes or until sauce has reduced by one-third and chicken is cooked through. Stir in lemon juice, then season.
Top chicken korma with sultanas, chilli and mint, then serve with naan.
